text: Bottle(75 cl). Hazelnut, caramel, just a little,thin white top. brown. a very good brune, One of the most interesting italian beer drinked(eating homemade pizza) in the last period. Good

bottle @ home
clear brown, quickly disappearing brown head
roasted malts, dark chocolate, hint of ashes, light licorice
sweet malts, caramel, milk chocolate, sweet licorice, light alcoholic

Second 75cl bottle, bought at factory in Genoa and tasted at home.
Mahogany brown, deep and impenetrable.
Quite persistent, medium thickness pale nut foam.
Nice aroma of caramel and chocolate and a hint of coffee, malty, very fine.
It tastes rich, coffee and malt in evidence and chocolate that gives smoothness; pretty big body, quite strong but silky.
A beer above average for sure.

My Bottom Line:
Hazelnuts, caramel and dark rum are balanced out by alcohol warmth and minty herbs in this silky creation.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam surrounds the dark amber.
-As with Maltus Faber brews, the rendering is flawless and elegant.
-This ones not necessarily aiming at the Dubbel style. Its doing its own thing, which I like.
-Mouthfeels not too heavy, with prickly carbonation.

Bottle.

Bella schiuma alta, cremosa e lenta a scendere, colore bruno opalescente, aroma di frutta secca, note di dattero e caramello, al palato corpo medio e richiama laroma con note di noce, dattero , caramello ed un finale appena aspro e amaro on sentori di frutta di bosco. Essendo fatta in Italia mi ha colpito la qualità di questa dubbel, non sarà perfetta ma mi ha lasciato delle grandi sensazioni, spero di berne ancora.

only 84??? ONE OF MY FAVOURITE DUBBEL!!! this beer has got a great fruity aroma and an incredible sweet fruity taste. Reddish-light brown colour. Dont worry for the quite body, this is an amazing abbey dubbel. Probably the master-brewer has came to study in a trappist monasterium in Belgium. This is an italian masterpiece. Other notes as malt and caramel. The end is very good with a touch of alcool and spices. SUPPORT this incredible microbrewery, the master-brewer is the nicest and most polite person in the world of beer!!! A MUST!

750ml bottle with minimal graphic, reddish brown capsule; pours dark brown with a decent beige head, liquor looks very thick in the glass. Nose is dark and decently complex, with licorice and prunes, dark fruits and burnt caramel. Sweetness lingers in the mouth, leaving anyway space to a slightly bitter finish like sweetened coffee: the nose gave better expectations, and at each sip this brew feels a bit unrefined, maybe a bit too young (my fault). Body is effectively a bit sticky, not very Belgian I should say. A rather demanding strong ale, not an everyday beer as one could think. Never have been a fan of this genre unless examples shining for complexity or drinkability, and this is not the case either; sorry Maltus Faber, your ales are usually excellent but I did not dig this one that much.

Color marrone scuro con bella schiuma beige. Aroma simile allo stile belga, caramello e cioccolata predominano. Anche in bocca è piacevole, dolciastra e bevibile, ma sul finire si notano sentori acidi e metallici che fanno scendere il livello complessivo della birra. Peccato perchè ammiro questo birrificio, ma ci può stare...

Gift from tonycaviar, big thanks!!

Poured murky, with a ruby-brown color and a nice beige lacing head. Spices, wood cask, forest berries, honey, plum cellar and red grapes in the aroma. Medium bodied and carbonated, somewhat oily consistency. Sweet taste and aftertaste. Well hidden alcohol, smooth, goes down easy.

0,75 l bottle as a gift, thanks tonycaviar!
Murky deep mahagony-brown beer with a nice fomay-creamy tan-beige head. Aroma of toffee, honey, spicies like clove, cinnamon, vanilla, mild chocolate and cocoa, wild forest berries and dried fruits. Interesting oak character. Medium bodied dubbel with a mild toffee and chocolate taste, fruits, raisins and plum, honey, light roasted-coffee flavor, some vinous notes. Light hop lurking in the finish bwith some roasted grains in the aftertaste. Verywell hidden alcohol, easy to drink, fine.
Bottiglia da 75 offerta da Max e Fausto in birrificio; sempre ottime le loro birre, questa brune poi è in formissima

Bottled. An unclear deer red beer with no head. The aroma has notes of malt, over ripe fruits, and yeast. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, yeast, fruit, and berries, leading to a dry metallic finish. The body is light. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Draught at Open Baladin, Roma. Pours mahoganey with a thick creamy tanned head. Aroma and flavour of dark fruits, anise, chocolate, earth and spicy yeast. Smooth mouthfeel. Rich fruity finish. Tastes great.

Bottle 750ml. @ home.[ Trade by Dedollewaitor ]. Clear medium to dark red brown color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, nutty, brown sugar - cane sugar, moderate yeasty, english licorice. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20091128]

Bottle @ Brewery. Pours unclear brown with a small stable creamy head and lacings. Complex nose and taste. Chocolate, toffee, vague roast, fruit, yeast. Warmth from alcohol. A bit oily and vinous. Smooth . . . Nice.

Colore bruno opaco,schiuma bianca.Aroma di nocciola e cioccolata.In bocca ritornano ancora la cioccolata e le nocciole con un tocco alcoolico che non guasta.Corpo pieno ma delicato.Non smetterei mai di berla.Ottima!!!

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of fiulijn. Hazy and opaque orangey brown with an off-white head. Aroma of yeast and roasted malt. Full-bodied, low carbonation, roasted malts, chocolate and an unclean fruitiness. Subdued bitterness. 260309

75 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small off-white head. Caramelish, light yeasty and vague yeasty aroma. Mild metallic flavoured with a light roasted breadish dry malt flavour. Light yeasty touch. Sweet caramelish finish.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2009 2009-07-07, 7-4-7-3-14=35Dark brown color; good head retention. Sweetish caramel and chocolate aroma, mild, very light fruits (plums) and Belgian yeast. Correct body structure, sweetish flavor, dark caramel and chocolate; medium to low bitterness, the final is too simple.. Well brewed, but not very complex.2009-03-26, courtesy of Yespr, 7-4-7-4-13=35Hazy brown color. Aroma of caramel and anchovies. Solid body, caramel flavor, correct bitterness, light residual sweetness. Pleasant but simple, there is something strange.

Coca-Cola coloured beer under yellow-brown head. Nutty, chocolate, sweet fusels... Fusels and alcohol returning in the taste, but generally quite balanced, if on the sweet side. Nuttiness and some dark fruit emerge, and despite the thick, slick initial MF, the beer is very drinkable. Unfortunately, it falls flat at the end. This is certainly a promising beer, big thanks to the brewer for sharing.

MMMMM
MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM faccia del bigné.....questa lho comprata dal magico besagnino di via Maddalena; dovrei passare in birrificio ma mi manca sempre il tempo maledizione (invece in centro ci sono tutti i giorni causa università... un quarto dora riesco a ritagliarla); questa Brune è veramente straordinaria, passa subito fra le mie preferite del birrificio! Già appena stappata emana un profumo spettacolare, poi in bocca è piena, delicata e possente al tempo stesso, beverina ma soddisfacente, ne vorrei altre 18739 bottiglie e probabilmente domattina non ne sarebbero rimaste più di 371.
scura schiuma media piuttosto persistente il naso è intenso profumato ,malato tostature frutta secca buona secchezza al palato buona bevibilità  nulla da ividiare alle belghe
Smooth, well attenuated, a deep brown ale which is surprisingly drinkable and at the same time has its "dark" character emerging in its finish.
